item.title: Financial investigators remain vigilant (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: On today's White Collar I am joined by Jack Dunn, President and Chief Executive of FTI Consulting, and Stephen Vickers, President and Chief Executive of FTI ? International Risk.
item.summary: On today's White Collar I am joined by Jack Dunn, President and Chief Executive of FTI Consulting, and Stephen Vickers, President and Chief Executive of FTI ? International Risk.

item.title: Dutchman swaps brewery for bank (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Wim Hekstra, deputy chief executive of ING Life in Hong Kong and Macau, is my guest on White Collar today. Hekstra oversees all sales channels for the life insurance business such as the company's agents, banks, brokers and independent advisers.
item.summary: Wim Hekstra, deputy chief executive of ING Life in Hong Kong and Macau, is my guest on White Collar today. Hekstra oversees all sales channels for the life insurance business such as the company's agents, banks, brokers and independent advisers.

item.title: HK sprinters dominant again
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: We're back at Happy Valley tonight after another successful Hong Kong international race meeting. The trainers of Hong Kong's top runners reported on Monday that they'd all pulled up well with Dubai now firmly in the sights of Derek Cruz and John Moore.
item.summary: We're back at Happy Valley tonight after another successful Hong Kong international race meeting. The trainers of Hong Kong's top runners reported on Monday that they'd all pulled up well with Dubai now firmly in the sights of Derek Cruz and John Moore.

item.title: Anthony Boswell on corporate rehabilitation (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Today's guest on White Collar is PricewaterhouseCoopers' Anthony Boswell. Mr Boswell is a Business Recovery Services partner based in Hong Kong.
item.summary: Today's guest on White Collar is PricewaterhouseCoopers' Anthony Boswell. Mr Boswell is a Business Recovery Services partner based in Hong Kong.

item.title: HK could sweep Cathay Pacific races
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Hong Kong's chances of taking all four major events for the Cathay Pacific International Races are the strongest since 2002.
item.summary: Hong Kong's chances of taking all four major events for the Cathay Pacific International Races are the strongest since 2002.

item.title: Racing podcast for December 9
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Racing editor Alan Aitken takes a look at today's Cathay Pacific International Jockeys' Championship. His pick for Race 5 is no. 12 Rocket and Gold.
item.summary: Racing editor Alan Aitken takes a look at today's Cathay Pacific International Jockeys' Championship. His pick for Race 5 is no. 12 Rocket and Gold.

item.title: Michael Ha on HK's insurance and pension future (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: In today's White Collar I speak with Aviva Life Insurance's head of marketing and business development, Michael Ha.
item.summary: In today's White Collar I speak with Aviva Life Insurance's head of marketing and business development, Michael Ha.

item.title: Godolphin light-handed in Cathay races
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Godolphin's stocks for the Cathay Pacific Hong Kong International Races next weekend have slumped sharply with the withdrawal of two of its three scheduled runners.
item.summary: Godolphin's stocks for the Cathay Pacific Hong Kong International Races next weekend have slumped sharply with the withdrawal of two of its three scheduled runners.

item.title: Countdown begins for International Races
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Racing returns to Happy Valley tonight but with just 11 days to go until the biggest day in Hong Kong racing, thoughts are turning to Sha Tin.
item.summary: Racing returns to Happy Valley tonight but with just 11 days to go until the biggest day in Hong Kong racing, thoughts are turning to Sha Tin.

item.title: 'Sustainability' key to becoming a world-class city...
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Hong Kong Science & Technology Parks will host the 5th annual InnoAsia Conference today and tomorrow under the theme of 'Sustainable City, Transportation and Energy'.
item.summary: Hong Kong Science & Technology Parks will host the 5th annual InnoAsia Conference today and tomorrow under the theme of 'Sustainable City, Transportation and Energy'.

item.title: Model jockey sets heartbeats racing
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Chantal Sutherland is likely to set heartbeats racing when the glamorous Canadian rider and model arrives for international week. The Jockey Club is holding a contest to see who can come up with the best Chinese translation for the Sutherland's name.
item.summary: Chantal Sutherland is likely to set heartbeats racing when the glamorous Canadian rider and model arrives for international week. The Jockey Club is holding a contest to see who can come up with the best Chinese translation for the Sutherland's name.

item.title: Happy Zero switches to the Mile
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Back at Happy Valley tonight after the International Sprint and Mile Trials at Sha Tin last Sunday. Happy Zero, who beat Sacred Kingdom in the Sprint Trial, has been switched to the Hong Kong Mile at the International Races on December 13.
item.summary: Back at Happy Valley tonight after the International Sprint and Mile Trials at Sha Tin last Sunday. Happy Zero, who beat Sacred Kingdom in the Sprint Trial, has been switched to the Hong Kong Mile at the International Races on December 13.

item.title: More debate needed on accounting reform (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: In this edition of White Collar, chief business reporter Enoch Yiu speaks to Alex Malley, chief executive of CPA Australia. Malley oversees all external affairs for the 122,00-strong accounting body.
item.summary: In this edition of White Collar, chief business reporter Enoch Yiu speaks to Alex Malley, chief executive of CPA Australia. Malley oversees all external affairs for the 122,00-strong accounting body.

item.title: Harilela hotelier on his family business (audio)

item.summary: Aron Harilela, director of Harilela Hotels, talks to business reporter Enoch Yiu in the latest episode of Meet the Corporate Architects series.

item.title: Happy Zero looks to take the crown
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: We're at Sha Tin for the Cathay Pacific International Sprint Trial and the Cathay Pacific International Mile Trial. Although an intriguing race in its own right, the International Mile Trial is overshadowed by the Sprint Trial which sees Happy Zero take...

item.title: Top tips for Happy Valley, November 18
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Although not yet at the top of his form, Collection (Weichong Marwing) was bursting with authority as he came clear for his first victory since the Hong Kong Derby, beating the same three horses - Unique Jewellery, Mr Medici and Thumbs Up - who chased...

item.title: Critical illness product looks to protect (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: David Knights, the Hong Kong general manager of Friends Provident International joins me in the studio today. He talks to me about his company's plans in Hong Kong and about their recent launch of a critical illness product.
item.summary: David Knights, the Hong Kong general manager of Friends Provident International joins me in the studio today. He talks to me about his company's plans in Hong Kong and about their recent launch of a critical illness product.

item.title: Obama's younger brother steps into the spotlight
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: For most fans and followers of US President Barrack Obama here in Hong Kong, it is well known that his half brother lives just across the border in Shenzhen.
item.summary: For most fans and followers of US President Barrack Obama here in Hong Kong, it is well known that his half brother lives just across the border in Shenzhen.

item.title: High hopes for Collection at international meets
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Racing fans can look forward to several upcoming races with an international flavour: Today's meeting at Sha Tin will feature the Cathay Pacific International Cup Trial and Racing editor Alan Aitken has favourited Collection.
item.summary: Racing fans can look forward to several upcoming races with an international flavour: Today's meeting at Sha Tin will feature the Cathay Pacific International Cup Trial and Racing editor Alan Aitken has favourited Collection.

item.title: One man feels the full force of Star Wars
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Imagine Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, C3PO and Chewbacca all on stage, all performed by just one actor. In a fast-paced show Charles Ross brings to life all the characters from the original Star Wars trilogy live on stage.
item.summary: Imagine Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, C3PO and Chewbacca all on stage, all performed by just one actor. In a fast-paced show Charles Ross brings to life all the characters from the original Star Wars trilogy live on stage.

item.title: Champion sprinters dominate the headlines
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: In today's show, Alan Aitken reports that sprinter Sacred Kingdom looks ready for a comeback after blowing through a 1000m trial at Sha Tin. Meanwhile, Hong Kong's most famous sprinter Silent Witness was honoured yesterday.
item.summary: In today's show, Alan Aitken reports that sprinter Sacred Kingdom looks ready for a comeback after blowing through a 1000m trial at Sha Tin. Meanwhile, Hong Kong's most famous sprinter Silent Witness was honoured yesterday.

item.title: Welcome to the world of WealthCraft
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: In this video interview, Kelly Tallas, chief executive of WealthCraft Systems, explains the business of managing pensions online.
item.summary: In this video interview, Kelly Tallas, chief executive of WealthCraft Systems, explains the business of managing pensions online.

item.title: Top tips for Sha Tin, November 7
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Ivan Allan, three-times champion trainer in Hong Kong died, aged 68, in his native Singapore after a long battle with illness. Allan moved to Hong Kong in 1992 after a dominant career in Singapore and Malaysia and became an equally irresistible force.
item.summary: Ivan Allan, three-times champion trainer in Hong Kong died, aged 68, in his native Singapore after a long battle with illness. Allan moved to Hong Kong in 1992 after a dominant career in Singapore and Malaysia and became an equally irresistible force.

item.title: Hot picks for an Exploding race
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Since the Jockey Challenge began over a year ago, turnover has reached a staggering HK$9 million. Racing editor asks in today's Off the Rails: When will we see the much-mooted Trainers Challenge?
item.summary: Since the Jockey Challenge began over a year ago, turnover has reached a staggering HK$9 million. Racing editor asks in today's Off the Rails: When will we see the much-mooted Trainers Challenge?

item.title: Viva Pataca or Collection?
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: While today's race will be Happy Valley, the main spot of news is which horse will Darren Beadman choose for this weekend's Mission Hills Sha Tin Trophy: Viva Pataca or Collection? Trainer John Moore says he'll let the jockey decide.

item.title: New CEO has big ambitions for AXA HK (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: This week's White Collar guest is newly appointed chief executive of AXA Hong Kong, Stuart Harrison. Although the financial tsunami has affected every company, the insurance giant has shown resilience and was able to bounce back quicker than other companies.
item.summary: This week's White Collar guest is newly appointed chief executive of AXA Hong Kong, Stuart Harrison. Although the financial tsunami has affected every company, the insurance giant has shown resilience and was able to bounce back quicker than other companies.

item.title: Heeding calls for regulatory reform (audio)
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: This week's guest on Monday Face is Julia Leung, the Undersecretary for Financial Services and the Treasury. Leung was among the first batch of undersecretaries to be appointed by chief executive Donald Tsang in 2008.
item.summary: This week's guest on Monday Face is Julia Leung, the Undersecretary for Financial Services and the Treasury. Leung was among the first batch of undersecretaries to be appointed by chief executive Donald Tsang in 2008.

item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Jockeys are in the news: Alex Lai has tested positive for a banned substance. Jeff Lloyd's (pictured) ankle injury is more serious than previously thought. An MRI turned up a fracture and now Lloyd's foot is in a cast for the next three weeks. Meanwhile,...

item.title: Tony Cruz has his eye on Sa Sa Ladies' Purse
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Today is Sa Sa Ladies' Purse day at Sha Tin. Six-from-10 winner Young Elite will start a $12 favourite. But find out why Alan Aitken thinks trainer Tony Cruz could take out the feature event with a first-up winner, as he has done three times previously.

item.title: Darren Beadman faces tough choice
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: Jockey Darren Beadman must make a choice between the ageing but still in form Viva Pataca and the up-and-coming Collection, which has put on weight since his Group wins last season.
item.summary: Jockey Darren Beadman must make a choice between the ageing but still in form Viva Pataca and the up-and-coming Collection, which has put on weight since his Group wins last season.

item.title: Exploding is hot stuff at Sha Tin
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: The latest news in racing is that legendary Sacred Kingdom will miss the next Sprinters Stakes in Japan due to foot injury. Trainer Ricky Yiu says he hopes it will be running fit by December.
item.summary: The latest news in racing is that legendary Sacred Kingdom will miss the next Sprinters Stakes in Japan due to foot injury. Trainer Ricky Yiu says he hopes it will be running fit by December.

item.title: Perfect Style the one to watch at Happy Valley

item.title: Enthused to join G1 racing in Tokyo
item.author: SCMP Staff
item.subtitle: John Size has announced that Enthused will travel to Tokyo next month to take part in Group One racing. Enthused will join Hong Kong superstar sprinter Sacred Kingdom.
